name: Brussels Sprouts with Bacon
description: Tender Brussels sprouts braised in stock with crispy bacon, onion, and garlic.
ingredients: 1/2 lb sliced bacon, cut into thin strips
5 cups chicken stock, vegetable stock, or water
instructions: Warm oil in a heavy-bottomed pot set over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until crisp, about 8 minutes.
Add onion and garlic. Saute gently until softened but not browned, 5-7 minutes.
Add wine, raise heat to high, and bring to a boil, stirring to scrape up any flavorful bits of bacon stuck to bottom of the pan.
When the wine has nearly evaporated, about 5 minutes, add Brussels sprouts.
Add stock, bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let stock simmer until sprouts are easily pierced with a knife, 12 to 15 minutes.
Serve sprouts in a bowl, family style.
